result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Travis Ryan Bass

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:25 AM Defendant Travis Ryan Bass appeared by video.  Attorney Matthew Krische appeared by video for Travis Ryan Bass.  Attorney Ellen Anderson in court for State of Wisconsin. He has new cases and OWI will be refiled. Going to put all on the same date.
Status conference scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on October 26, 2022 at 08:45 am.
INSTRUCTIONS FOR HOW TO APPEAR REMOTELY (10-26-2022)

Present at TSC: ADA Anderson and Attorney Krische. Scheduling Order completed.  FPT set for January 10, 2023 at 10:30 a.m., JT set for February 9, 2023. Motions due November 18, 2022, responses due December 9, 2022, rebuttals due December 23, 2022.  Witness lists due December 30, 2022.  21TR1764 and 21TR2202 #1; 21CM82 #2; 21CM85 #3 and 22CM35 #4.
Telephone scheduling conference on August 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.

4:02 PM Defendant Travis Ryan Bass in court.  Attorney Ellen Anderson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Matthew Krische in court for Travis Ryan Bass.   OWI and 21CM82 should be tried first
Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on July 26, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

9:50 AM Prosecuting attorney Ellen Anderson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Travis Ryan Bass in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court. Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint. The defense waived reading of the complaint and stood mute to the charges.
Status conference scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 7, 2022 at 09:50 am.

08:48 AM Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant's Attorney Matthew Krische appeared.  Defendant is in patient in MN.  Attorney Krische will check out and find out more of when he might be getting out.  Court will not issue a warrant at this time  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 09:50 am.
Initial appearance on April 26, 2022 at 08:45 am.

Defendant is not to drive any motorized vehicle: (a) unless defendant is in possession of a valid Wisconsin operator's license for the type of motor vehicle being driven; (b) defendant and such motor vehicle are insured as required by law; and (c) defendant is in possession of valid proof of insurance while operating the motor vehicle.     Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.     The defendant shall submit to random urine/PBT testing as required by any law enforcement officer.  
THIS $1500.00 CASH COVERS THIS CASE AND CASE 21CM85 - Post $1500.00 once and sign two bonds.

03:20 PM Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Travis Ryan Bass, appeared by video from Clark County Jail with Attorney Krische appearing by video.  States asking for $1000.00 cash bond.  Court orders that he appear in person from now forward.  The $1500 cash bond on 21CM85 also apply to this case. State asking that every time he comes in court that he be PBT'd.  Court will not add that condition.  Initial appearance scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 08:45 am.
